instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No image
threads.message:
Hello Everybody

Working on no video problem macbook pro 17" 2011 ( I know apple extended guaranty for video issue but no video is out off warranty rules)

Machine turn power on
I can here star dong sound
Mac OS loading and i can up and down volume
No video build in LCD and external display
Tested known good LCD and data cable ( checked L9000 but 0v and no <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> )
GPU is warming normally
I heat around 200C to GPU with using bga machine nothing changed

I can reball ATI but its not working too long ,  When i changed chips (seller says absolutely new but  generally refurbished) its create problem in 3-4 months ..


What is yours suggestions ? Can you find good chips anywhere?

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No image
threads.message: No video is not out of warranty rules...as long as the board/machine fails their diagnostics, it gets replaced. I've had several 2914's replaced and at least 2 of them had no video at all on the LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No image
threads.message:
Did you try external LCD with the internal one disconnected?
If there is no video then I would take it to Apple first and see if they will accept it.
